question: It is true that managerial skills are categorized into technical, human, and conceptual skills.
It is true that managerial skills are not categorized into technical, human, and conceptual skills.

It is true that technical skills do not involve using specific knowledge and tools to perform a job.

It is true that human skills do not involve interacting and communicating with people effectively.

It is true that conceptual skills do not involve strategic thinking and decision-making.

It is true that lower-level managers do not need technical skills.

It is true that middle-level managers do not need human skills for coordination.
It is true that top-level managers need strong conceptual skills for strategic planning.
It is true that top-level managers do not need conceptual skills for strategic planning.

It is true that leadership skills are not essential for motivating and guiding teams.

It is true that planning and strategy skills do not help in setting goals and determining efficient paths to meet objectives.

It is true that communication skills are not vital for conveying information effectively within an organization.

It is true that organizational skills do not help managers balance multiple tasks and deadlines.

It is true that problem-solving skills are not essential for identifying and resolving issues within an organization.

It is true that decision-making skills are not crucial for managers to make informed choices.

It is true that delegation skills do not allow managers to assign tasks effectively to team members.

It is true that conflict management skills do not help in resolving disputes within the workplace.

It is true that mentoring is not an important skill for developing team members.

It is true that commercial awareness is not essential for understanding market dynamics.

It is true that strategic thinking does not involve aligning daily objectives with the organization’s mission.

It is true that time management is not a key component of organizational skills.

It is true that effective communication is not vital for building relationships and conveying information.

It is true that leadership skills do not include decisiveness and conflict resolution.
